263.mention_context: Protesters in Bathurst turned their backs on Australian Prime Minister John Howard as he arrived for a Liberal Party luncheon.

Candentity.name: Howard_Davies_(economist)
Candentity.desc: Sir Howard John Davies is a British economist and author, who has held various leadership positions including chairman of NatWest Group, the London School of Economics, and the Financial Services Authority, and is currently a Professor at the Paris School of International Affairs.

Candentity.name: 2007–08_Writers_Guild_of_America_strike
Candentity.desc: The 2007-08 Writers Guild of America strike was a 14-week labor dispute between 12,000 film and television screenwriters and 397 American film and television producers, seeking increased funding and resulting in a tentative agreement and eventual ratification.

Candentity.name: Denean_Howard
Candentity.desc: Denean Elizabeth Howard-Hill is an American athlete who won a gold medal in the 4x400 meters relay at the 1984 Summer Olympics and held the national high school record in the 4x400 meters relay for 18 years.

Candentity.name: John_Howard_(sprinter)
Candentity.desc: John Howard is a sprinter from the Federated States of Micronesia who holds the record as the fastest sprinter in the Micronesian Region and South Pacific Regions, having competed in the 2012 Summer Olympics.

Candentity.name: John_Howard_(NIOSH_director)
Candentity.desc: John Jackson Howard is a physician and public health administrator who served as the director of the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) and coordinated health programs for rescue workers affected by the September 11 attacks.

Candentity.name: Jeffrey_R._Howard
Candentity.desc: Jeffrey Robert Howard is the Chief United States Circuit Judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit.

Candentity.name: John_Howard_(optical_physicist)
Candentity.desc: John Howard was a prominent optical physicist who served as president of the Optical Society of America, founded Applied Optics, and held various scientific positions, including chief scientist of the Air Force Geophysics Laboratory.

Candentity.name: Third_Howard_Ministry
Candentity.desc: The Third Howard Ministry was the 62nd ministry of the Australian Government, led by Prime Minister John Howard, serving from 2001 to 2004 and notable for having all its members still alive as of 2021.

Candentity.name: Fourth_Howard_Ministry
Candentity.desc: The Fourth Howard Ministry was the 63rd ministry of the Australian government, led by Prime Minister John Howard from 2004 to 2007, following the 2004 federal election and preceding the 2007 federal election.

Candentity.name: Mark_Howard_(journalist)
Candentity.desc: Mark Howard is an Australian television presenter and journalist who has worked for Fox Sports and Network Ten, hosting and reporting on various sports events, including AFL, cricket, and motorsport, and currently hosts his own podcast, the Howie Games.

Candentity.name: Yün_Nan_Province
Candentity.desc: Yunnan Province is a landlocked province in southwest China, spanning approximately 394,000 km2, with a population of 48.

Candentity.name: Nan_Province
Candentity.desc: Nan Province is one of Thailand's seventy-six provinces located in upper northern Thailand, bordering Uttaradit, Phrae, and Phayao provinces, as well as Sainyabuli province in Laos to the north and east.

Candentity.name: Yun_nan_Province
Candentity.desc: Yunnan Province is a landlocked region in southwestern China, known for its natural resources, diverse plant life, and rich cultural history, with a population of approximately 48.

Candentity.name: Yunnan
Candentity.desc: Yunnan is a landlocked province in southwest China, spanning approximately 394,000 km2, with a population of 48.

Candentity.name: Muang_Nan
Candentity.desc: Muang_Nan is one of Thailand's seventy-six provinces, located in upper northern Thailand, bordering Uttaradit, Phrae, and Phayao provinces to the south, and sharing borders with Laos to the north and east.

Candentity.name: Yün_nan_Province
Candentity.desc: Yunnan Province is a landlocked province in southwest China, covering approximately 394,000 km2 and having a population of 48.

Candentity.name: Yun_Nan_Province
Candentity.desc: Yunnan Province is a landlocked province in southwestern China, spanning approximately 394,000 km2, with a population of 48.

Candentity.name: Nan_province,_Thailand
Candentity.desc: Nan is one of Thailand's 76 provinces, located in upper northern Thailand, bordered by Uttaradit, Phrae, and Phayao provinces to the south, and Sainyabuli of Laos to the north and east.

Candentity.name: Kingdom_of_Benin
Candentity.desc: The Kingdom of Benin was a pre-colonial kingdom in West Africa, specifically in what is now southern Nigeria, with its capital in Benin City, that existed from the 11th century to 1897 when it was annexed by the British Empire.

Candentity.name: Nan_County
Candentity.desc: Nan County, also known as Nanxian, is a county in Hunan Province, China, located under the administration of Yiyang city, with a registered population of 683,500 and a permanent resident population of 632,800 as of 2015.

1374.mention_context: A BM-14 multiple rocket launcher, similar to the type likely to have launched the M-14 munitions found by UN Inspectors on August 26.

Candentity.name: United_Nations
Candentity.desc: The United Nations (UN) is an international organization established in 1945 to promote peace, security, and cooperation among its member states.

Candentity.name: United_Nations_Office_of_Internal_Oversight_Services
Candentity.desc: The United Nations Office of Internal Oversight Services is an independent office that assists the Secretary-General in fulfilling internal oversight responsibilities, conducting activities such as internal audit, investigation, and reporting to ensure the efficient and effective use of UN resources and staff.

Candentity.name: UN_(album)
Candentity.desc: UN is the debut studio album by British singer-songwriter Dan Black, released in 2009, which received mixed reviews from critics.

Candentity.name: United_Nations_(gang)
Candentity.desc: The United Nations is a criminal gang originating from Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, formed in the 2000s by members of diverse ethnic backgrounds.

Candentity.name: United_Nations_Development_Programme
Candentity.desc: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is the United Nations' global development network, promoting technical and investment cooperation among nations and providing expert advice, training, and grants to developing countries to help them achieve the Sustainable Development Goals.

Candentity.name: United_Nations_peacekeeping
Candentity.desc: The United Nations peacekeeping is a unique instrument that helps countries torn by conflict create lasting peace by monitoring and observing peace processes, assisting ex-combatants in implementing peace agreements, and providing various forms of support, including confidence-building measures, power-sharing arrangements, and economic and social development.

Candentity.name: Type_63_multiple_rocket_launcher
Candentity.desc: The Type 63 multiple rocket launcher is a 12-tube, 107mm towed rocket launcher produced by China in the 1960s, widely used until the late 1980s and still in service with specialized PLA formations.

Candentity.name: Un_(prefix)
Candentity.desc: The prefix "un_" is a bound morpheme that is placed before the stem of a word, altering its form and meaning, and is used to create new words with different semantic meanings and lexical categories.

Candentity.name: UN_(band)
Candentity.desc: UN was a South Korean musical group formed under NH Media, consisting of two members, Choi Jung-won and Kim Jeong-hoon, who released five albums from 2000 to 2005 and had a significant hit with the single "For a Lifetime".

Candentity.name: Un_(album)
Candentity.desc: Un is the 11th studio album by Chumbawamba, released in 2004, which blends electronic and folk music with world music samples, serving as a bridge between the band's earlier and later sounds.

620.mention_context: Pluto as viewed by New Horizons, July 13, 2015.

Candentity.name: New_Horizons_(strategy)
Candentity.desc: New Horizons is the UK government's 10-year strategy for mental health in England, published in 2009, aiming to improve mental well-being and services by 2020 through a comprehensive programme of action.

Candentity.name: Pluto
Candentity.desc: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt, a ring of bodies beyond Neptune's orbit, with a moderately eccentric and inclined orbit, five known moons, and a reddish-brown cap on Charon's north pole composed of tholins.

Candentity.name: Ofakim_Hadashim
Candentity.desc: Ofakim Hadashim, also known as "New Horizons", is an Israeli art movement founded in Tel Aviv in 1942.

Candentity.name: Seventh_Sojourn
Candentity.desc: Seventh Sojourn is the eighth studio album by the Moody Blues, released in 1972.

Candentity.name: Découvertes_Gallimard
Candentity.desc: Découvertes Gallimard is an editorial collection of illustrated, pocket-sized books that provide concise introductions to various subjects, written by experts for a general audience, with over 588 titles and spin-offs published since its inception in 1986.

Candentity.name: The_Vyborg_Side
Candentity.desc: The Vyborg Side is a 1939 Soviet drama film directed by Grigori Kozintsev and Leonid Trauberg, concluding a trilogy about the life of a young factory worker, Maxim.

Candentity.name: New_Horizons
Candentity.desc: New Horizons is an interplanetary space probe that was launched in 2006 to perform a flyby study of the Pluto system and other Kuiper belt objects, becoming the fifth space probe to achieve escape velocity and leaving the Solar System.

Candentity.name: New_Horizons_(The_Sylvers_album)
Candentity.desc: New Horizons is the sixth album by the R&B group the Sylvers, a Los Angeles-based group from California.

Candentity.name: New_Horizons_(Flyleaf_album)
Candentity.desc: New Horizons is the third studio album by American rock band Flyleaf, released in 2012, produced by Howard Benson and featuring lead vocalist Lacey Sturm in her final appearance with the band before her departure.

Candentity.name: Bright_Horizons
Candentity.desc: Bright Horizons is a US-based child-care provider and largest employer-sponsored child care provider, offering a range of services including child care, back-up care, tuition management, and education advising, headquartered in Watertown, Massachusetts.

1366.mention_context: OLPC in Galima (Nigeria) showing children with their lime green XO laptops.

Candentity.name: SimCity_(1989_video_game)
Candentity.desc: SimCity is a city-building simulation video game developed by Will Wright, where players create and manage a city, balancing residential, industrial, and environmental needs to increase the standard of living and prevent bankruptcy.

Candentity.name: OLPC_XS
Candentity.desc: The OLPC XS is a Linux-based OS designed for generic servers to provide network connectivity and management features for XO laptops, including Sugar Learning Platform, backups, and content updates.

Candentity.name: RiscPC
Candentity.desc: The RiscPC is a RISC OS/Acorn RISC Machine computer launched in 1994, which superseded the Acorn Archimedes and allows PC compatible software to be run through an Acorn PC card and software.

Candentity.name: TRPC
Candentity.desc: TRPC is a family of transient receptor potential cation channels in animals, characterized by non-selective cation permeability and activation by various stimuli, including phospholipase C, diacylglycerol, and membrane stretching, with specific members implicated in various physiological and pathological processes.

Candentity.name: OLPC_XO-3
Candentity.desc: The OLPC XO-3 is a computer hardware article that is currently a stub, requiring further development and information to be added.

Candentity.name: Education_in_Nigeria
Candentity.desc: Education in Nigeria is overseen by the Federal Ministry of Education, with a decentralized system and regional differences in quality, curriculum, and funding, resulting in a large population of out-of-school youth.

Candentity.name: PearPC
Candentity.desc: PearPC is an architecture-independent PowerPC platform emulator that can run PowerPC operating systems, including pre-Intel Mac OS X, on x86-based systems, using a just-in-time processor emulation core that translates PPC code into x86 code.

Candentity.name: One_Laptop_per_Child
Candentity.desc: One Laptop per Child was a non-profit initiative that aimed to provide low-cost, low-power laptops to children in developing countries to improve education, but it was ultimately shut down in 2014 due to disappointing sales.

Candentity.name: AAPC_(healthcare)
Candentity.desc: The American Academy of Professional Coders (AAPC) is a professional association that provides certification and training services to medical coders, billers, auditors, compliance managers, and practice managers in the United States.

Candentity.name: OLPC_XO
Candentity.desc: The OLPC XO is an inexpensive laptop computer designed to provide access to knowledge and opportunities for children in developing countries, featuring a rugged and low-power design, flash memory, and a pre-installed operating system derived from Fedora Linux.

Candentity.name: Ciudad_Lineal
Candentity.desc: Ciudad Lineal is a district of Madrid, Spain.

Candentity.name: Parque_Centenario
Candentity.desc: Parque Centenario is an extensive public park located in the Caballito district of Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Candentity.name: Parque_del_Centenario
Candentity.desc: The Parque del Centenario is a 100,000m2 park in Algeciras, Spain, established in 2007 to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Algeciras Conference, built on the ruins of the old Fuerte de San García.

Candentity.name: Municipalidad
Candentity.desc: The Municipalidad is a Spanish term for municipality used in many Latin American countries, referring to the governing body of a particular territory, which is often referred to as "municipio".

Candentity.name: Parque_de_la_Ciudad
Candentity.desc: The Parque de la Ciudad is a former amusement park located in the Villa Soldati neighborhood of Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Candentity.name: Torre_Bicentenario
Candentity.desc: The Torre Bicentenario was a planned skyscraper in Mexico City that would have been the tallest building in Mexico and Latin America, but was officially canceled in 2007, although there are rumors it may still be built.

Candentity.name: Centenario
Candentity.desc: The Centenario is a Mexican gold coin that is the subject of this article, distinct from the Lamborghini Centenario supercar and other uses of the name.

Candentity.name: Ciudad_del_Saber
Candentity.desc: Ciudad del Saber is a government-sponsored cluster of academic, tech, and non-profit organizations in Panama, located in the former United States Army South headquarters, Fort Clayton.

Candentity.name: Ciudad_Perico
Candentity.desc: Ciudad Perico is a town and municipality in Jujuy Province, Argentina, considered a stub article about a place in the region.

Candentity.name: En_la_Ciudad_de_la_Furia
Candentity.desc: "En la Ciudad de la Furia" is a song by Argentine rock band Soda Stereo, written by Gustavo Cerati and released in 1989 as the first single from their album Doble Vida.

Candentity.name: North_East_Lancashire_Card_and_Blowing_Room_Operatives%27_and_Ring_Spinners%27_Association
Candentity.desc: The North East Lancashire Card and Blowing Room Operatives' and Ring Spinners' Association was a British trade union that existed from 1886 to 1974, representing workers in the cotton textile industry.

Candentity.name: South_East_Lancashire_Provincial_Card_and_Blowing_Room_Operatives'_Association
Candentity.desc: The South East Lancashire Provincial Card and Blowing Room Operatives' Association was a trade union formed in 1887, representing cotton industry workers in Ashton-under-Lyne and surrounding areas of Lancashire, England, and merged with other unions in 1967.

Candentity.name: South_East_Lancashire_Provincial_Card_and_Blowing_Room_Operatives%27_Association
Candentity.desc: The South East Lancashire Provincial Card and Blowing Room Operatives' Association was a trade union founded in 1888, led by William Henry Carr, a British trade unionist and political activist, who served as its secretary and was involved in various labor movements and political campaigns.

Candentity.name: The_Upstairs_Room
Candentity.desc: The Upstairs Room is a 1972 Holocaust survivor autobiography by Johanna Reiss that recounts her childhood in occupied Holland during the Nazi invasion.

Candentity.name: Rooms_of_the_House
Candentity.desc: Rooms of the House is the fourth studio album by American post-hardcore band La Dispute, released on March 18, 2014 through their own label Better Living.

Candentity.name: The_Living_Room
Candentity.desc: The Living Room was a venue that featured live artists performing every night of the week in its main area and a smaller upstairs space called "Googies Lounge".

Candentity.name: East_Room
Candentity.desc: The East Room is a large event and reception room in the White House complex, used for various functions such as dances, receptions, and ceremonies, and has undergone redecoration over the past two centuries.

Candentity.name: Iraq_War_and_the_War_on_Terror
Candentity.desc: The Iraq War was referred to as "the central front in the War on Terror" by President George W.

Candentity.name: Northern_Textile_and_Allied_Workers'_Union
Candentity.desc: The Northern Textile and Allied Workers' Union was a trade union representing cotton factory workers in northern Lancashire, England, founded in 1886 and merging with the Transport and General Workers' Union in 1984.

Candentity.name: Jens_Henrik_Beer
Candentity.desc: Jens Henrik Beer was a Norwegian businessperson, farmer, and politician who held various positions, including vice consul, parliamentarian, and mayor, and was also a pioneer in rational farming and wrote articles on agriculture.

Candentity.name: Het_vind
Candentity.desc: Het vind is the debut studio album by Swedish singer-songwriter Marie Fredriksson, released in 1984, which became a top twenty hit in Sweden and included singles such as "Ännu doftar kärlek" and "Natt efter natt".

Candentity.name: Joos_de_Beer
Candentity.desc: Joos de Beer was a renowned Early Netherlandish painter from Utrecht.

Candentity.name: Schou_Brewery
Candentity.desc: The Schou Brewery is a former Norwegian brewery.

Candentity.name: Jannie_de_Beer
Candentity.desc: Jan Hendrik de Beer, also known as Jannie de Beer, was a South African former rugby union player who played flyhalf for the Springboks national team, scoring 181 points in 13 tests.

Candentity.name: Edwin_John_Beer
Candentity.desc: Edwin John Beer was a British chemist, geologist, and mineralogist who pioneered the development of Viscose Rayon, a man-made fibre, and made significant contributions to the discovery of industrial minerals in India during World War I.

Candentity.name: Bosteels_Brewery
Candentity.desc: Bosteels Brewery is a Belgian brewery founded in 1791, known for brewing four beers, including Tripel Karmeliet, DeuS, Pauwel Kwak, and Monte Cristo, before being sold to AB InBev in 2016.

Candentity.name: Hung_Cee_Kay
Candentity.desc: Celeste Hung Cee Kay is a Hong Kong swimmer who competed in the 1988 Summer Olympics and won bronze in the 1986 Asian Games, later becoming an executive director of Hop Hing, a Hong Kong restaurant operator.

Candentity.name: Edwin_Beer
Candentity.desc: Edwin Beer was an American surgeon who pioneered the endoscopic treatment of papillary bladder tumors and is recognized as the founder of electrosurgery of the bladder.

Candentity.name: Lindemans_Brewery
Candentity.desc: Lindemans Brewery is a Belgian family brewery based in Vlezenbeek that produces lambics, a style of Belgian ale made with raw wheat and wild yeast.

Candentity.name: New_York_(2019_typeface)
